page.title: 13Shopping Survey, Bristol
page.content: We sampled 82 shoppers on several days outside a small food store in Bedminster. Of these 82, we found: The average number of visits (4 p.w.) 60% go food shopping 3+ times p.w. 57% used the store as "convenient" 83% use local supermarkets as well ...5l% walking there ...47% driving there 42% use distant Super Stores as well ...74% driving ...6% free bus (provided by store) ...1% bus When we asked if they would shop at a large supermarket/store if very close 82% Yes; 18% No. We think that about 18% of our sample is not able to travel far because of age, illness, babies or lack of car. These shoppers need the service of small local shops.
